glsa.title: Xlockmore: Denial of Service
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow in Xlockmore might allow remote attackers to cause a Denial of Service.

background.p: Xlockmore is just another screensaver application for X.

description.p: A Denial of Service flaw was found in the way Xlockmore performed the passing of arguments to the underlying localtime() call, when the ‘dlock’ mode was used.

impact.p: A local attacker could possibly cause a Denial of Service condition and potentially obtain unauthorized access to the graphical session, previously locked by another user.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Xlockmore users should upgrade to the latest version:
